benchmark_details.name: AGENTS NET
benchmark_details.overview: AGENTS NET is a new benchmark for multi-agent reasoning that measures the ability of multi-agent systems to collaboratively form strategies for problem-solving, self-organization, and effective communication given a network topology. It evaluates multi-agent systems on fundamental distributed computing problems such as leader election, consensus, maximal matching, and others.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To assess the ability of agentic networks to coordinate and collaborate to solve problems.

data.source: Custom generated problems based on distributed computing tasks.
data.size: Up to 100 agents with practically unlimited scalability.

methodology.calculation: Scores are based on strict correctness criteria, where instances are only considered solved if every agent satisfies the task specification.
methodology.interpretation: A valid global solution confirms coordinated conflict resolution among agents.
methodology.validation: Validated by running multiple instances and averaging results.
